title: Gerimed Mobility
overview: Gerimed Mobility, your one-stop medical supply shop. Having been in in operation for a few years it was time for them to go live. Needing both an online shop and a design matching their branding efforts.

outline.goal: To provide their customers the ability to view their products and place orders online with ease.
outline.scope: An admin panel for managing products and orders and an store-front for customers to place orders.
outline.industry: Gerimed Mobility supplies its local area with all their medical needs. From hospital-beds to personal hygiene.

challenges.title: Branding efforts
content: Gerimed Mobility has their own third-party designer. I had to make sure the design matched their branding efforts while still keeping it UX/UI friendly
I had some liberty in design choices but kept them to minimal while focusing on the functionality of the online shop.

challenges.title: Online Shopping
content: Since the entire website was custom and the back-end semi-custom I opted for a custom shopping cart and implemented the order managment from the ground up.
Users can register and login to their accounts to view all their past orders, or simply track their order if they have the reference.

challenges.title: Admin Managment
content: Having an extensive product catalog, it was mandatory that the staff be able to manage the products and content of the online shop.
I used strapi with a few custom plugins to allow staff to manage their customers orders, inventory, and promotion offered.

conclusion: When starting with this project, I decided to build most of the platform from the ground-up, but due to time constraint I ended up using Strapi for the back-end with a few custom plugins. There where, however, a few other constraints I had to keep in mind but the project proved itself to be quite managable.

Since most of the back-end was complete, I mostly had to focus on architecting the front-end. I ended up trying to use the MVC architecture for the frontend; with react being the View, Strapi the Model and state machinces for the Controller. This allowed me to scale the platoform, while keeping a sound mind of where everything was and how it worked.
SEO, performance and accessibly were aided by the use of Gatsby, allowing me to focus on more thought provoking tasks like the cart functionality and order managment.
All-in-all the project broadened my knowledge on numerous aspects of such a large scale project and it certainly expanded my ability to work on large scale projects.
